description:
Canyon that could have some potential for fun elements, but for now it is full of trees.

Approach

Follow the river on the southern side, first across the forest and then a long slab. From time to time you can peak into the canyon.

Descent

First part is made of slabs, if one day the canyon gets washed out, this might become a paradise for slides. That part ends with a 20m waterfall from which on there is 500m of walking in a bit more incised but still not narrow section. After the waterlevel rises due to an affluent, there are a few narrow rappels, though after each one it is possible to get out. But, as long as there are branches and trunks everywhere, it's really not the most appealing canyon.

Exit

Walk through the field and within 5min you're back at the car.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

name: Walibach
